Welcome to my server! :)

I'm a recent grad of the batch 2023. üè´ I've completed my Bachelor's in ;Computer Science and Engineering.; üê±‚Äçüíª; I've recently completed my 6 month Internship with ;Amazon; as an SDE Intern. üé∂ ;Know more about my ;work-experience
I'm currectly looking for full-time ;SDE/SWE; or ;Developer; roles. Hit me up: ;aviral19rana@gmail.com,mailto:aviral19rana@gmail.com; üìß

I enjoy solving complex programming challenges and coming up with creative solutions for them.
I also enjoy building simulations and visualizations, check some of them out here: ;<mention>projects</mention>

When I'm not building awesome projects, I like to:

<heading>Academic Coursework:</heading>;

;

Beauty in Chaos; ;A simple project, written in JS. Made using p5JS, draws random abstract art.; ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;Javascript; ‚Ä¢ ;HTML/CSS; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ This project made me understand Javascript. ; ;GitHub: ;https://github.com/aviral10/Beauty_in_Chaos,https://github.com/aviral10/Beauty_in_Chaos; ;Live: ;https://aviralrana.me/Beauty_in_Chaos/,https://aviral10.github.io/Beauty_in_Chaos/; ;

Visualizing Paths; ;Visualised Path-Finding Algorithms that I learned on paper during college. Created an interactive web application built using JavaScript and p5.js library. Included two pathfinding algorithms: Breadth-First Search (BFS) and A* (A Star). Additionally, it features a maze generator based on a randomized DFS.; ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;Javascript; ‚Ä¢ ;p5JS; ‚Ä¢ ;HTML/CSS; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ First big project that I made entirely from scratch. ‚Ä¢ Followed Object Oriented Design. ; ;GitHub: ;https://github.com/aviral10/Visualizing-Paths,https://github.com/aviral10/Visualizing-Paths; ;Live: ;https://aviralrana.me/Visualizing-Paths/,https://aviral10.github.io/Visualizing-Paths; ;

EKANS - Reverse Snake; ;Extended scope of Visualising Paths' project in this fun game. Contrary to classic snake game, you control the food here. Snake uses path-finding algorithms to chase the food. ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;Javascript; ‚Ä¢ ;p5JS; ‚Ä¢ ;HTML/CSS; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ This project helped me grab my first internship!; ;GitHub: ;https://github.com/aviral10/Snake_but_you_the_snack,https://github.com/aviral10/Snake_but_you_the_snack; ;Live: ;https://aviralrana.me/Snake_but_you_the_snack/,https://aviral10.github.io/Snake_but_you_the_snack/; ;

Handwritten Digit Recognition; ;Developed a web UI for identification and prediction of hand-drawn digits. Removed back-end dependency of the model and shifed the computation to the front-end. This improved overall performance of the project. Trained a CNN model that had an accuracy of 99.74% and used it to identify digits. Created a 3D visualization of the CNN model that is used under the hood for digit recognition using Three.js ; ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;JavaScript; ‚Ä¢ ;TailwindCSS; ‚Ä¢ ;ThreeJS; ‚Ä¢ ;NodeJS; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ Fell in love with TailwindCSS with this project. ‚Ä¢ Tackled and solved a lot of performance issues from shifting backend computation to fixing memory leaks happening in browser.; ;GitHub: ;https://github.com/../Handwritten_Digit_Recognition,https://github.com/aviral10/Handwritten_Digit_Recognition; ;Live: ;https://handwritten-digit-recognition-eight.vercel.app/,https://handwritten-digit-recognition-eight.vercel.app/; ;

Natural Selection Simulator [Abandoned mid-dev]; ;Simulated artificial brain cells for creatures and established a demonstration of Natural Selection. The creatures were able to adapt over generations following survival of the fittest for the natural selection criteria. Couldn't fully develop the project, but it still holds significant value. Hence putting it here. This project had a lot of scope and great research potential, I might pick it up again in the future making better development decisions this time.; ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;Python; ‚Ä¢ ;Javascript; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ Simulated artificial brains for creatures. ‚Ä¢ I understood concepts of multithreading and multiprocessing with this project. ‚Ä¢ One of the reasons this project was abandoned was the poor choice of coding language, considering the use-case was very computation heavy. I should have used C/C++.; ;GitHub: ;https://github.com/aviral10/Natural_Selection_Sim,https://github.com/aviral10/Natural_Selection_Sim; ;

PyStar üå†; ;An innovation project I made while interning at Adobe. Created an app that automated a task of fetching business data and generating case-review presentations automatically along with elaborated graphs and charts.; ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;Python; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ The project is still being used internally. ‚Ä¢ Received accolades from senior managers.; ;Demo Version only: GitHub: ;https://github.com/aviral10/pystar,https://github.com/aviral10/pystar; ;Live: ;https://aviral10-pystar-main-is3c43.streamlit.app/,https://aviral10-pystar-main-is3c43.streamlit.app/; ;

Personal Portfolio Website; ;Innovated a Discord styled personal portfolio website using ReactJS and TailwindCSS. Decoupled data dependency for UI elements by creating a Config driven UI enabling easy updates to the website. Developed an engaging user experience using modern design principles within a responsive single-page application(SPA).; ;Tech:; ‚Ä¢ ;ReactJS; ‚Ä¢ ;TypeScript; ‚Ä¢ ;JavaScript; ‚Ä¢ ;TailwindCSS; ;Project highlight: ‚Ä¢ Config driven UI, meaning I can add/update content on the website by making changes to the config file only and no code needs to be touched. ‚Ä¢ Learned ReactJS with this project. ‚Ä¢ Website is responsive with slightly different UI for mobile devices, do check it out. ‚Ä¢ There are no if-else statements in the entire project.; ;GitHub: ;https://github.com/aviral10/Portfolio,https://github.com/aviral10/Portfolio; ;Live: ;https://aviralrana.me/,https://aviralrana.me/; ;

messages.content: Amazon Inc.; ;Software Developer Engineer Intern; ;January 2023 - June 2023 ;Location: Bangalore, India ; ‚Ä¢ Collaborated with the; Amazon Music ;International Expansion (IX) team. ; ‚Ä¢ Successfully launched a novel Home Tab experience of Amazon Music for Android Automotive clients. ; ‚Ä¢ Migrated the old home experience to a newer architecture. ; ‚Ä¢ Developed a front-end module for handing network calls made to the backend. ; ‚Ä¢ Contributed to the development of the back-end data processing layer as well. ; ‚Ä¢ Orchestrated the deployment of a robust CI/CD pipeline. ; ‚Ä¢ The pipeline was utilized for experimentation, testing and feature development. ; ‚Ä¢ Implemented th new Home Tab support for Navigation Apps such as Google Assistant and Waze. ; ‚Ä¢ Worked on Front-end for the development of a personalised widge (My Presets). ; ‚Ä¢ My Presets was successfully launched to production. ; ‚Ä¢ Skills: C++ ¬∑ Java ¬∑ Android ¬∑ TypeScript ¬∑ Kotlin ¬∑ Amazon CloudWatch ¬∑ Python ¬∑ JavaScript

Adobe Systems; ;Technical Support Engineer; ;August 2023 - Present ;Location: Noida, India ; ‚Ä¢ Working as a Technical Support Engineer with ; Adobe Analytics ; global support team. ; ‚Ä¢ During the internship developed a chatbot for Service Desk. ; ‚Ä¢ The bot helped in narrowing down the search space of First Call Resolution queries. ; ‚Ä¢ Developed an automation tool from scratch and deployed it to company servers to be used internally. ; ‚Ä¢ Skills: Python ¬∑ Adobe Analytics

Here's an excerpt from a little poem that I wrote. :)

<headingxl>I once drew a friend</headingxl>;
;.......
I told her to not desire rain
She wasn't ready to know 
What the rain would do 
But she craved and as of one day
I left my window open.
It was raining.
It was raining love.

Love that she craved for, so much.
She jumped out of my canvas and 
Took a leap out in the open

I held my breath
And looked at her,
She was happy, happier than she ever was 
The rain of love was making her colors wash.
 
Her glitters, I painted with so much Love 
Were washed away 
Her crimson dress was spoilt,
Her colors faded
And she slowly blurred away 

I cried in grief, cause she was the only friend I had
I couldn't pick my colors up,
I was all wet and soaked in love 

The moon showed up and its light paved her way 
She crossed oblivion, bidding me goodbye.
.......

And here's an excerpt from an unfinished novel that I started writing during college. :)
I don't know if I will ever "finish" it.

<headingxl>Red, Chapter 1: Yo</headingxl>;

;‚ÄúWell, I'm not here for Red, I'm here for me, I'm not here for Red‚Äù I said while I looked out for her here and there. I sat down on my usual spot and opened my book, still waiting for Red to show up. I looked up leaning back on the bench, the sky wasn't as bright as it usually was, the birds were flying north, and there was a plane leaving a jet trail behind. I was busy staring at the sky and suddenly someone blocks my view from behind. ‚ÄúYo‚Äù, she greets me with. I raised my hand and held her nose don't ask me why, I just felt like. ‚ÄúWe meet again‚Äù, I replied.

She sits next to me and looks happier than yesterday, or maybe she usually is like this, how long have I known her anyway?  We chatted and not once had I taken my eyes off her, her eyes, her big eyes detailed with mascara, I wonder if she put on that for me? Maybe she had a date or something. Is she seeing someone, maybe I should ask her?  My internal thoughts were making it hard to concentrate. Is sh- She interrupts me and asks ‚ÄúWhy are you looking at me like that?‚Äù giving me a funny look and I got alarmed and apologized for my creepy behavior. She giggled and said ‚ÄúYou're Cute‚Äù to which I had no reply. ‚ÄúHey maybe we should go out for a coffee next time?‚Äù I asked. With a few seconds of silence which felt like hours she replied ‚ÄúSure‚Äù. ‚ÄúI'm Aviral‚Äù, I said, offering my hand. ‚ÄúI'm Lily‚Äù she replied and shook my hand.
